# Security Policy

## Reporting a Vulnerability

If you discover a security vulnerability, **please do not open a public GitHub issue**.

Instead, use the **GitHub Security Advisories**:
- Go to the **Security â†’ Report a vulnerability** tab in this repository.

Please include:
- A detailed description of the vulnerability.
- Steps to reproduce the issue.
- Proof-of-concept code (if available).
- Impact assessment (what an attacker could do).

## Disclosure Process

Once a vulnerability is reported:
1. We will investigate and validate the issue.
2. We will work on a fix and coordinate a responsible disclosure.
3. A security advisory will be published if appropriate.

## Security Best Practices

While using this project:
- Keep dependencies up to date.
- Follow the principle of least privilege.
- Review third-party integrations carefully.

## Scope

This security policy applies to:
- The core codebase.
- Included scripts and configuration files.

Out of scope:
- Third-party dependencies (report issues to their maintainers).
- Misconfigurations outside of this repository.

---

Thank you for helping keep this project secure.
